chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank K. Hall Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 22CM886.
Credit for 85 days, if revoked.
DE is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
P&P to notify the court, in writing upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. ***NO THC*** Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  P&P to notify the court, in writing upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
DE to be released as to this case

Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Frank K. Hall Jr. Defendant Frank K. Hall Jr. in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. State in victim rights compliance. On state's motion counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in. DE pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds DE guilty of Count 1. Court withholds sentence and places DE on 3 years probation with conditions; Concurrent to 22CM886; credit for 85 days served if revoked. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court. DE is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
With Attorney Gardner a MH has been set to 10/14/22 at 9:30 regarding the bond motion filed.
Defendant's Motion for Bond Reduction

Defendant Frank K. Hall appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Gardner.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gardner.  Clerk. M.Burke. Parties agree with the Dr. Report. DE states that he is competent. Court finds that the DE is competent to proceed. PH set to 09/09/22 at 9:15 in intake.
and Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
Due to the letter filed by Dr. Niess the CH has been set out with attorney Knapp and attorney Foster to 08/31/22 at 3:00.

Submitted by WFU
re:  Competency Eval Extension Letter
Order form CR 205 & Crim Complaint sent to DHS, WCS notified and copy to the jail.
For Competency Exam

Defendant Frank K. Hall appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Knapp raises issue of competency; Court orders competency exam.   Bond continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Submitted by Atty Michelle Knapp
